entry.desc: limit on CO2 emission for a given climate impact

entry.name: fossil fuel combustion and industrial processes
land use, land-use change, and forestry
entry.desc: Greenhouse gas inventory sector that covers emissions and removals of greenhouse gases resulting from direct human-induced land use

entry.name: forestry and other land-use
entry.desc: Greenhouse gas inventory sector that covers emissions and removals of greenhouse gases resulting from direct human-induced land use
man-made gases that can stay in the atmosphere for centuries and contribute to a global greenhouse effect
amount that must be paid for the right to emit one tonne of CO2 into the atmosphere

entry.name: Emissions Database for Global Atmospheric Research
entry.desc: a joint project of the European Commission Joint Research Centre and the Netherlands Environmental Assessment Agency which estimates emissions of all greenhouse gases, air pollutants and aerosols

entry.name: Potsdam Real-time Integrated Model for probabilistic Assessment of emissions Paths
Climate Analysis Indicators Tool
entry.desc: The Climate Analysis Indicators Tool (CAIT) is an information and data analysis tool on global climate change and provides a comprehensive and comparable database of greenhouse gas emissions data (including all major sources and sinks) and other climate-relevant indicators

entry.name: A Community Emissions Data System for Historical Emissions

entry.desc: An emissions factor is a representative value that attempts to relate the quantity of a pollutant released to the atmosphere with an activity associated with the release of that pollutant
An emission inventory (or emissions inventory) is an accounting of the amount of pollutants discharged into the atmosphere

entry.name: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
entry.desc: The United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) established an international environmental treaty to combat 'dangerous human interference with the climate system', in part by stabilizing greenhouse gas concentrations in the atmosphere
Transportation, Industry, Agriculture, and Land Use and Forestry are four global emission sectors that roughly correspond to the U.S. sectors

entry.name: Global warming potential
entry.desc: Estimate of how an atmospheric gas affects global climate change

entry.name: 100 year Global warming potential
entry.desc: Global warming potential calculated over a period of 100 years

entry.name: World Meteorological Organisation
entry.desc: specialised agency of the United Nations for meteorology

emissions inventory that comes from direct measurement and are done to evaluate measured emissions for a geographical region or sector, using measurements from hand-held OGC cameras, truck-mounted cameras, drones and planes, and satellites

entry.name: Global Temperature Change Potential
entry.desc: the change in global mean surface temperature at a chosen point in time in response to an emission pulse relative to that of CO2
rate used for discounting future benefits or costs to society

entry.name: Short Lived Climate Forcers
entry.desc: greenhouse gases and other climate pollutants that have relatively short atmospheric lifetimes compared to carbon dioxide
Carbon dioxide equivalent or CO2e means the number of metric tons of CO2 emissions with the same global warming potential as one metric ton of another greenhouse gas
A projected development in time of the emission of a greenhouse gas or group of greenhouse gases, aerosols and greenhouse gas precursors.

entry.name: Food and Agriculture Organization Corporate Statistical Database
entry.desc: FAOSTAT website disseminates statistical data collected and maintained by the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO)

entry.name: Special Report on Emissions Scenarios
entry.desc: 2000 report by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change

entry.name: Shared Socioeconomic Pathways
entry.desc: Over the past few years, an international team of climate scientists, economists and energy systems modellers have built a range of new “pathways” that examine how global society, demographics and economics might change over the next century. They are collectively known as SSPs
energy form not subjected to any human conversion process
direct use at the source, or supply to users without transformation, of crude energy, that is, energy that has not been subjected to any conversion or transformation process

Baseline scenarios depict a future state of society and/or environment in which no new environmental policies are implemented apart from those already in the pipeline today; or in which these policies do not have a discernable influence regarding the questions being analysed

The atmospheric lifetime of a species measures the time required to restore equilibrium in the atmosphere following a sudden increase or decrease in concentration of the species in question in the atmosphere.

entry.name: Non-methane volatile organic compound
entry.desc: set of organic compounds that are typically photochemically reactive in the atmosphere and are marked by the exclusion of methane

Cumulative carbon dioxide (CO₂) emissions represents the total sum of CO₂ emissions produced from fossil fuels and cement since 1750, and is measured in tonnes. This measures CO₂ emissions from fossil fuels and cement production only – land use change is not included.

International agreement from 12 December 2015 within the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) dealing with greenhouse gas emissions mitigation, adaptation and finance starting in the year 2020
Final energy consumption covers all energy supplied to the final consumer for all energy uses. It is the sum of energy consumption in each final demand sector
